page.title: 05GRANDAD RECALLS 47 YEARS AGO
page.content: No one was allowed on the grass bank of the school playground. One time a ball went on to the bank, and because I was so tall I stretched out to get it and the bank monitors caught me and I went to have the cane. { In the war}we would have to leave our classes and go to the{shelters}below the school which were sandbags all the way up. There was a little door to go through to get in, a house was bombed a way from school. We went visiting American soldiers at the docks, and we used to say,{"Any gum chum?" }The hall on a Sunday was used for{Sunday School it was run by{Christ Church,}which was next to the school. The superintendant was called{Soapy Joe. }When we went home we would listen to a programme called{'Children's Hour'. In 1941 I {was evacuated}to North Wales. I came back after the war.
